boardgame.name: Biolum
boardgame.description: Biolum is a VR sci-fi narrative experience that invites you on a mission to explore the uncharted depths of the ocean. With voices of Charlotte Rampling and Dominique Tipper, you discover a beautiful world of bioluminescent creatures.

boardgame.name: Keine Panik!: Family Edition
boardgame.description:
This is the family edition from "Don't Panic".
There are category cards as in the base game, but each has 3 categories with one of the levels hard, medium and simple.
At the beginning of the game a level is set for each player, easy for children, hard for adults with many knowledge.
It's also a timed game, but each round the active player gets only 1 category and has to name 5 words, which match this category. The timer is stopped and the remaining number are the points he gets for this round.
3 times each player is allowed to ask for a new category (3 chips are available for each player to mark this)
After 5 rounds the player with the highest number of points wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Everdell
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




The game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer and remains in active development. Some information and gameplay elements may change in the future.




From Everfrost to Bellsong, many a peaceful year have passed in Everdell - but the time has come for new territories to be settled and new cities to be established. You will be the leader of a group of critters intent on just such a task. There are buildings to construct, lively characters to meet, events to host - you will have a busy year ahead of you! Will the sun shine brightest on your city before the winter moon rises?

This is a digital implementation of the board game Everdell.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Ratz Fatz Lieder-Spiel-Kiste
boardgame.description:
This children educational game is driven by the 29 children songs which are on the included CD.
The children may sing the songs while playing. There are multiple variants which can be played, e.g. grabbing the right wooden figure (30 included) or carton tile when it's named in the song.
This game should help learning the German language, concentration and reaction.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Memo Match
boardgame.description:
In this game you have to collect 3 bird cards.
16 bird cards, 16 square memory cards (attributes)
Each bird has one of two possibilities of the 4 attributes: eyes, feathers on the head, beak, claws.
The activ player turns a bird card from the bird card deck.
Now he turns 1 memory card after each other, as long as he finds a matching attribute to the bird card.
If he finds all 4, he wins the bird card. If he turns a wrong attribute or a right the second time, his turn is over.
In bioth cases all memory cards are turned on the backside.
Who wins the third bird card wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Mice of the Wilderness
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Some mice from the wilderness that you might encounter when playing Mausritter. There are 4 NPC cards, each with a portrait and brief description.

boardgame.name: Bingo Bongo
boardgame.description:
This is a combination of a traditional memory game and Tic Tac Toe.
Each player has his own Tic Tac Toe board with animals and fruits on the fields.
On players turd, he has to find pairs as in normal memory, but only the images on hios Tic Tac Toe board are relevant.
If he finds one of his, he covers this image.
Who first covers 3 in a row on his Tic Tac Toe board wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Fox Kids
boardgame.description:
In Fox Kids each player gets a board with 8 different cartoon character on them. You can also find these characters on a pile of circle shaped tiles that are in the middle of the table. Each player blindly chooses 5 tiles and try to see if they match any of the characters you have on your board. If so you can keep them, if not you return them face up, so everyone can see which characters is on that tile. Luckily there are a few wild cards among the pile which you can use to fill in a missing character on your board.

If you want to try to make it a bit harder, you can play level 2. You flip over your board and instead of the preprinted characters you get 8 empty circles on your board. On the added notepad every player picks for themselves 8 different characters they try to collect. In this way you can't really know what characters your opponents try to find. Whoever get's all of their characters first wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Geef oma een kus
boardgame.description:
Don't you just hate that grandma always wants to give you those big wet kisses. You are not the only one who doesn't like this.
In this game everyone shares the same pawn that goes along a 12 step track. In order players play cards from their hands. On the cards are different types of actions that can either impress or disgust grandma. When you impress her the pawn moves up the track, when you disgust her the pawn goes down the track. And the end of your turn you take cards from the pile until you have 4 cards in hands again.

A player that plays a card which lands the pawn on step number 12 gets a big wet kiss from grandma. There is a lip shaped stamp and a lipstick you can use to create your own grandma's kiss on your cheeks.

The first player to get three kisses loses the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Dobbelkoning: Uitbreiding van het Koninkrijk
King of the Dice: The Board Game
El Rey de los Dados: El Juego de Mesa
Roi & Compagnie: A la conquete de nouveaux territoires!
Würfelkönig: Das Brettspiel
boardgame.description:
A strategic dice game. Based upon King of Dice this board game consists of two board game pieces with 15 territory spaces. Players compete for cards by rolling and rerolling dice. These cards allow the players to place castle tiles and gain gemstones and dragon fires on the game boards.
When enough castles are placed the game ends and the players gain points for their biggest territory, their gemstones and the most dragon fires. The player with the most points wins.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
The game is new and still in shrink wrap!
I will ship from Germany and I am willing to ship anywhere.
Please ask me, for the shipping costs for your land.
I will charge shipping at cost. Everything will be well packed.
You can pay me through Paypal or bank transfer to my German bank account but any fees charged must be covered by you.
If you buy more games, then I make all in one package!
We have a large private collection of games. Due to space and time constraints we must rid ourselves of some of the games. Therefore, these are private sales.

boardgame.name: Stuff You Should Know
boardgame.description:
Prove you know your stuff as you take turns answering trivia, each question from a different episode of Stuff You Should Know. The first player to fill their board with one of each category of tokens wins.

Presented by Trivial Pursuit, this game is a collaboration with the hit podcast Stuff You Should Know (SYSK) and their hosts Josh and Chuck.

Plays similar to Trivial Pursuit but without a board, as competitors race to be the first to answer a question correctly in all 6 categories (History; Pop Culture; Myths, Legends, and Conspiracies; Science & Tech; Humans; SYSK Selects)

boardgame.name: Les Simon
boardgame.description:
Each summer you spend your vacation with cousins in the mansion of grandpa, Hector Simon, the greatest adventurer in the world! This evening, he is absent and all his enemies will take the opportunity to take revenge. But they didn't count on you!
Search the mansion, create traps and save as many treasures as possible from the clutches of the Jealous!

Setup : choose a character and draw a random personality.
Phase 1 : the Jealous come inside, draw the first Clock card, it indicates the the number of Jealous to enter the mansion.
Phase 2 : Search the manor, every player draw Object cards.
Phase 3 : Assemble your objects to create traps.
Phase 4 : Reduce the resistance of the jealous by triggering your traps to save treasures.


For each trap, you need to explain its operating mechanism out loud! Make way for the imagination and the pain!

Phase 5 : All the Jealous still in the mansion will be able to steal Treasures cards.

The game ends when one full turn of the clock has been completed.

The game also ends immediately when 10 treasures have been stolen by the Jealous. You have all lost then and Grandpa will be very disappointed.

boardgame.name: Quickomino
boardgame.description:
Square tiles with each has 4 different images, one for each edge. There are 3 sets (different colors) used for the different player numbers.
1 is placed in the middle. Each player gets the same amount of the remaining tiles (all tiles from 1 color are used).
All players play at the same time. They place their tiles
in the middle with matching (equal) images on all touching edges (domino rules).
The first player who places his last tile in the middle, wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Toggolino: Activity – Die Oktonauten: Erforschen, Retten, Beschützen
boardgame.description:
Childrens version of activity based on the "Die Oktonauten" TV series from Toggolino (SuperRTL, Toggo plus).
It's a under water submarine race. There are characters and things known from the series. These are described by one player with pantomime, drawing or description. Only the players who finds the right answer can move forward.
It can be played in 2 teams or cooperative.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Géants Stupides
boardgame.description:
In Géants Stupides ("Stupid Giants"), you land with your rivals on the mythical island of Night Mountain.

In this jubilant "stop or else", you land on the island of the mythical Night Mountain with only one obsession: get as many stars as possible! But your quest will be full of pitfalls!

So climb with your giant and pray to the ancestor to move rocks... Aim for the highest spot possible and jump to catch stars!

But the greedier you are, the more flying nonos and carcass hits will lead to nasty falls!

Borrow the superpower of the Ancestor's Head to transform the mountain by moving cubes... And unleash the Giant that growls inside you!

A colorful wooden game, with drawings by Marion Poinsot, the illustrator of Naheulbeuk comics.

With several levels: from the giant beginner to the stupid expert!

boardgame.name: Cepheus Journal (Issue 009)
boardgame.description:
From the website description

We didn’t have a special theme for this issue, but it eventually became a winter holiday issue.

From Ewan Spence we have an article about the 2nd Battalion Royal Australia Regiment for Modern War. Then from Jo Jaquinta we have the third part of his Raider’s Lament and an article about an out-of-the-ordinary monster.

Our editors have also contributed. Brett has interviewed Paul Elliot of Zozer Games and written a review of the Cepheus Deluxe rules. Paul has written an adventure and finally P-O has made a subsector map a written a short write-up of an alien race.

boardgame.name: Vs System 2PCG: The Marvel Battles – Into the Darkness
boardgame.description:
This terrifying conclusion to the Darkness and Light story arc for Vs. System 2PCG provides an unnerving glimpse of the undead creatures that go bump in the night as well as the uniquely
qualified heroes brave enough to shine a light on them. Journey into the shadows if you dare and challenge your opponents with the powers of darkness and light.

boardgame.name: Twin Palms
boardgame.description:
Hidden somewhere along the tropical coastline, you'll find a charming little beach town called Twin Palms. Here you'll see dolphins jumping, lovers holding hands, and children playing in the sand...always in pairs.

Twin Palms is a beach-themed escape from your traditional trick-taking card game. At the start of each of the game's 5-8 rounds, you bid the number of tricks (0-5) you think you'll claim with the ten cards in your hand. Wait, ten cards = five tricks? Yes, because each time you play to a trick, you play two cards at once!

You play the game with 1-3 suits of cards depending on your desired level of difficulty and the number of players at the table; each suit has cards numbered 0-10 and a wild, with each card appearing twice. The strongest play is a pair of cards that are the same number, with high numbers beating low ones, and with palm trees beating dolphins, which beat sunglasses, which beat pairs that are of different suits. If no one plays a pair, then whoever played the highest single card wins the trick. After five tricks, you score points if you've met your bid exactly. (If you bid a non-zero number of tricks but missed, you still score 1 point per trick taken.)

What's more, if you want to play risky, you can place bets on your bids, giving you an additional way to win (or lose) points. Whoever has the most points after the designated number of rounds wins!

boardgame.name: The Office Trivia Game
boardgame.description: Are you a true Dunderhead? Find out with 150 questions testing your Scranton smarts.

boardgame.name: Connecto
boardgame.description: Connect items on your board according to the Challenge card and give shape to an object. To win, be the first to guess what you are drawing. With its fast-paced and seamless gameplay, Connecto is terribly addictive!

boardgame.name: WAU
boardgame.description:
Adopt puppies and be an ever-loving owner! - it is the slogan of the WAU which draws attention to the importance of adopting shelter animals and of being a responsible, loving owner.

In the game, players adopt puppies from the shelter and then trying to protect them from other players. Puppies need to be loved in their home as it is in real life, therefore, this way you can protect them from any upcoming danger. If you have 5 puppies in your little garden AND you prove that you are a responsible dog owner (aka you belove them with loving cards), you win the game. However, you should be careful and suspicious with the neighbours!

It is a fun, easy-to-learn, confrontative card game with the cutest dogs recommended for families and friends.

—description form the designer

boardgame.name: Galileo Project
boardgame.description:
30 years after sending the first colonial ships from Ganymede, Humanity decided to launch Project Galileo!
Its goal: settle onto the four main satellites of Jupiter (Io, Europa, Ganymede and Callisto) in order to broaden Human presence in the solar system.

This project is named after the Italian intellectual Galileo, the first to observe these four satellites in the sky in 1610.

Play as the same corporations involved in the events of Ganymede and settle onto the 4 satellites of Jupiter by acquiring robots from Earth and Mars, recruiting experts, developing technologies and building superstructures.

Galileo Project is a standalone game in the Ganymede universe, combining combos and engine building.

— description from the publisher (translated).

boardgame.name: Tales from the Loop: The Board Game – Gorgosaurus
Tales from the Loop: The Board Game – Invasive Species
boardgame.description:
Expand your Tales from the Loop - The Boardgame experience with some invasive species from the late Cretaceous! The school is buzzing with wild Rumors about how the ice cream truck was attacked and the driver... eaten?!

The expansion contains a masterfully designed miniature of a Gorgosaurus Libratus as depicted in the art by Simon Stålenhag, as well as a completely new Scenario featuring it, and all the cards and sheets needed to bring it into your game.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Tales From the Loop: The Board Game

boardgame.name: Spice Heist
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A Dune-themed hack of Honey Heist. Why? I couldn't tell you. Please enjoy.

It is the year 10,192 After Guild. You've heard that the Harkonnens have hidden a massive supply of spice somewhere in the galaxy. You want that goddamn spice more than anything. It’s time to make some Harkonnens very mad.

boardgame.name: Tales from the Loop: The Board Game – The Runaway
boardgame.description:
Expand your Tales from the Loop - The Boardgame experience with this runaway Machine! For the past week black vans and agents in suits have been seen in the area around the Loop. Rumors have it that they are searching for a spy...

This expansion contains a masterfully designed miniature of the Runaway Machine as depicted in the art of Simon Stålenhag, as well as completely new Scenario featuring it, and all the cards an sheets needed to bring it into our game.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Tales From the Loop: The Board Game

listing.notes:
NIS. Unpainted version. I have an extra copy.
Buyer pays shipping from 80226- likely a USPS med. flat rate box. Happy to arrange local pick up in Denver.
Please contact me with any questions.

boardgame.name: Do Not Wake Up Netiqrys!: An archeological adventure in the Ancient Egypt
boardgame.description:
An expedition, composed of subjects of various backgrounds (there are distinguished Egyptologists, valiant officers of Her Majesty, archaeologists in search of notoriety with their daughters, treasures hunters of every ream etc., and their respective carriers), runs through the corridors and rooms of an ancient Egyptian Temple miraculously remained intact in the sands of the desert, in search of treasures and precious finds. But there are those who make good guard. And, above all, the Eternal Sleep of the Queen's Spirit is very heavy, but not entirely bombproof.

Do Not Wake Up Netiqrys! is a three-dimensional tabletop game, which is played with miniatures and on a map containing three-dimensional elements. It is a quite traditional dungeon crawler, so your characters (miniatures) move on rooms and corridors in order to reach the Hall of the Sarcophagus of the Mummy and to collect treasures. What makes the game a bit particular is the random generation of the path and of the enemies every time the characters turn a corner or open a door.

The rules are very simple but immersive, in order to satisfy both old friends of colonial or exotic miniature games and casual players or children. A game can involve a number of players ranging from one to six.

To play DNWN! it is necessary to have about twenty miniatures, normally in 28 or 20mm, including the Mummy, some of her Followers, some "Undead", as well as members of the archaeological expedition and their local carriers. You also need a 12-sided dice, a pair of 6-sided dice, some furniture to be disseminated on the path and a play area of about 90 cm - 36" per side, which will represent the perimeter of the Temple, within which the path will have to wind.

Everything else you will need is present in this issue that, in addition to the rules of the game and two sides of very complete “fast reference” tables (to play you will only need those), provides you with the "Character Cards", containing the characteristics of each of the protagonists, and also with the tiles for the construction of the path (including corridors, rooms, doors and so on) as you see it in the photos, to print, paste and crop. In fact, DNWN! involves the random construction of the path during the game, an element that makes each match deeply different from any other and that allows the game to be particularly enjoyable even in “solo mode”.

boardgame.name: Dragonscales: Promo Pack
boardgame.description:
Limited edition promotional cards for Dragonscales. Includes powerful new items and artifacts for the Treasure deck!

Cards are:
Temporal Shifter - Once per round, you may pay 1 dragonscale to allow any player who is moving to move 1 additional space

Gem of Warding - Discard to cancel any attack against any player

Potion of Silence - Discard during the choose actions step when any player reveals their dice. That play may re-roll all of their rage outcomes

Counterspell - Discard at any time to cancel any villainy card as it is being played

Dragondmend Scroll - Discard the card to make all other players return one dragon wound of their choice back to the dragon’s head

boardgame.name: Quest: Volume I
boardgame.description: Quest: Volume I is a game with 2,520 general knowledge questions: World, Arts and Entertainment, Society, Science and Technology, Sport and Leisure and Variety. Before answering each question, the player must bet the amount of points he wants to walk on the board if he gets the answer right. Players can even choose the topics they know best to answer. But it's good to know all the subjects, as in the end you'll have to answer a question on the topic chosen by the other players. Are you up for this challenge?

boardgame.name: Art of Wuxia Destiny Deck
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

With this supplement, players who roll critical failures will be permitted to draw a destiny card onto the center of the table. Thereafter, when any character spends qi, they may choose to use that qi to perform one of the abilities listed on one of the destiny cards, discarding it! This helps to make getting set back by poor rolls more thematic - and simulates the sudden cinematic plot resurgences prevalent in the wuxia genre.

boardgame.name: Art of Wuxia Initiative Deck
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

This initiative deck gives you another way to track turn order. Deal each player a number of cards equal to their INIT score. Let him use whichever is higher as his initiative score for that round. If you have more than one card, the others could be used for tie breakers.

boardgame.name: AGON: 24 táblajáték a nagyvilágból
boardgame.description:
AGON (Ancient Games Of Nations) 24 traditional board games in a playable book. The collection features 24 old abstract strategy games from all over the world, such as ancient Egypt and Mesopotamia, Africa, the Far East, North- and Central America, and Europe.

Pierrot, the author, wanted to make his book playable, therefore it was designed to provide large, hard cardboard surfaces, and the pawns and dice were supplied as punch board attachments. However, for an even better visual experience, players are encouraged to creatively collect or make more suitable pawns from various sources, such as glass pearls, pebbles, shells, buttons, pieces of wood, or pottery.

The 24 games included in this book are not exact replicas, as in many cases there are no original models considered authentic. Often, the circles and grids were just drawn on the sand, and then erased when the game was over. Nonetheless, enough information is available to create most of the prototypes.

The rules described in the book are based on the most widely accepted version for each game – and were thoroughly tested.
This Hungarian book includes the following titles, along with the author's own artwork:

The Royal Game of Ur, Bizingo, Fanorona, Puluc, Rimau-rimau, Yoté, Patolli, Jarmo, Mig mang, Ringo, Owari, Alquerque, Fox & Geese, Agon, Tablut, Tonkin, Siga, Pah tum, Senet, Sz’kwa, Surakarta, Hasami shogi, O-pat ko-no and Yut.


Pierrot táblajátékok iránti szenvedélyének és hosszú kutatómunkájának köszönhető ez a különleges album, amely huszonnégy tradicionális absztrakt stratégiai játékot tartalmaz. Valamennyi játék izgalmas időutazás távoli korokba, távoli vidékekre, mint az ősi Egyiptom és Mezopotámia, Afrika, Távol-Kelet, Észak- és Közép-Amerika, valamint Európa.A könyv készítésekor fontos szempont volt, hogy az „játszható” legyen: nagyméretű táblákat, merev felületeket biztosítson, és legyen mellékletként megfelelő mennyiségű játékfigura és dobóeszköz. Az utóbbiakhoz kartonkorongos megoldás szolgál, azonban a játékosok bátran lehetnek kreatívak, és maguk is gyűjthetnek a témához, környezethez, korhoz illő bábukat – fakorongokból, különleges gombokból, kerámia- és üveggyöngyökből, kavicsokból, kagylókból, és még ki tudja, hányféle forrásból.

A könyvben található 24 táblajáték nem szigorú értelemben vett rekonstrukció, mivel a legtöbbhöz nincs autentikusnak tekintett, eredeti modell. Ezeket a köröket és vonalakat sokszor csak a földbe karcolták, s a parti végén eltaposták a nyomokat. Csupán a kiváltságosok engedhették meg maguknak, hogy mesteremberekkel táblát készíttessenek. Ilyenek kerültek elő egyiptomi és mezopotámiai királysírokból, vagy a gyarmatosítások kora utazóinak gyűjtéséből. Etnográfusok kutatásai nyomán viszont rengeteg apró részletet ismerünk, amelyek révén megalkotható a legtöbb táblajáték prototípusa.

Az egyes játékokhoz közölt szabályok a leginkább elfogadott változatot tartalmazzák – minden esetben alapos tesztelést követően.

Az AGON – 24 táblajáték a nagyvilágból című album a következő játékokat tartalmazza – Pierrot saját illusztrációival:

Ur királyi játéka (The Royal Game of Ur), Bizingo, Fanorona, Puluc, Rimau-rimau, Yoté, Patolli, Jarmo, Mig mang, Ringo, Owari, Alquerque, Róka és libák (Fox and geese), Agon, Tablut, Tonkin, Siga, Pah tum, Senet, Sz’kwa, Surakarta, Hasami shogi, O-pat ko-no, Yut.

boardgame.name: Runes of Zun: Promo Card Set 2
boardgame.description:
A set of rare and powerful cards for Runes of Zun. Each card is designed to make gameplay a little crazy. Include one, two, or all three in your Runes of Zun deck to spice up your game. You can even add multiple copies of the three cards – play your way!

“Mimic” lets you copy a card

Use it to make a "copy" of any active card on the table and put it in your hand. Just pick a card that's in play (including ongoing effects), grab it, and put Mimic in its place. It's like Steal and Reserve combined – only better!

“Decoy” is a new reaction card

This reaction card prevents you from being affected. After resolving the action you're reacting to, you can't be touched until your next turn. Drop this decoy down and make your escape!

“Cheat” lets you take from the discards

Yes, any card. Just play Cheat, then start digging through the discard pile like a crazy person until you find that sweet card which your opponent foolishly threw away. It's yours now! Oh, and you can Boost it, letting you take more cards. This can be a big game-changer.

Note: The Kickstarter version has a star on the cards that identify them as from the Kickstarter. Second printing doesn’t.

boardgame.name: Runes of Zun: Promo Card Set 3
boardgame.description:
A set of rare and powerful cards for Runes of Zun. Each card is designed to make gameplay a little crazy. Include one, two, or all three in your Runes of Zun deck to spice up your game. You can even add multiple copies of the three cards – play your way!

“Surge” lets you power up

Use it to peek at the top 5 cards in the deck and put any modifiers you find right into your hand! After you put the rest of the cards you looked at back on top of the deck, you'll have advanced knowledge of those cards, which can be very useful.

“Divine” lets you get an extra card every turn

Take a card from the deck at the end of your turn. If you can also guess the card type before you take it, you can keep Divine in play for your next turn!

“Absorb” is a new reaction card

Play it as a reaction, then take that action and any modifiers played against you into your hand. Sweet, sweet revenge...

Note: The Kickstarter version has a star on the cards that identify them as from the Kickstarter. Second printing doesn’t.

boardgame.name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Loot-Splosion Campaign Supplement
boardgame.description:
The Loot-Splosion Campaign Supplement will collect all digital scenarios and campaigns in physical printed format. It also includes an additional two complete campaigns.

Available scenarios and campaigns include:
- Ravenous Wattle Gobbler Scenarios
- Steve the Psycho Scenarios
- Crumpets and 'Zza Campaign
- 2x Loot-Splosion Campaigns
- All Bounty Scenarios (Bounty scenarios have their special rules printed on the bounty card and use an existing scenario map layout.)
- Core Game Campaign
- Skags at the Gates Campaign
- Robot Revolution Campaign

–description from the publisher

boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Robot Revolution
Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Skags at the Gates
Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Steve the Psycho
Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – The Ravenous Wattle Gobbler

boardgame.name: Clash of Armies: Medieval – Climas
boardgame.description:
8-card Weather expansion for Clash of Armies: Medieval.


The second expansion of the game that adds a weather mechanic that will modify the conditions of how we play.

boardgame.name: My Bot Bytes
boardgame.description:
My Bot Bytes is a fun and fast-paced action programming game that will have the entire family coding without them realizing it! Teaches kids (and adults) some basics of coding!

You are interns trying to impress the Scientist to be the chosen one! Control two Bots to collect spare parts hidden around a Robotics lab. Bots can be coded to move using Navigation control cards but watch out! - the Scientist's Navigation System only gives limited navigation cards. Use logic loops to build logic into the Bots to move around obstacles (which include the Scientist's pets!). Be the first to navigate your Bot to collect all spare parts and complete your assembly board to win!

Game setup randomized so that no two games are alike!

boardgame.name: Adventure Builder
boardgame.description:
Adventure Builder is a perfect game for kids and families to get started with roleplaying games and shared story-telling.

Easy for parents and kids to quickly dive into fantasy roleplaying experiences.
Simple & exciting character progression.
An entire city to explore between adventures, with dozens of encounters, games, and puzzles.

The Adventure Builder box contains everything you need to start the adventure without any delay. Explore the world of Florea using a large, full-color map, delve into the rules and the secrets hidden in the Guide's Handbook, pick your equipment and pets from the Equipment Shop, grab a character sheet, dice, and tokens - and you're ready to play!

A variety of Encounter, Creature, Coin, and Story cards will create the adventures for you without any need for lengthy preparations.

boardgame.name: Everdell: House of Peace Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Promotional Card made available at the Tabletop Tycoon booth at PAX Unplugged 2021.

Common Construction (Green)
Cost: 2 twigs, 2 resin
Worth: 1 base point

"You may give one card to an opponent to gain 1 resource and draw 1 card."

This is an alternate artwork card for Tea House found in Everdell: Newleaf.

boardgame.name: Alexandros
boardgame.description:
Simple wargame following Alexander the Great's conquest of the Persian Empire and India.

Each player has two armies, led by Alexander and Antipater on one side, Darius and Memnon on the other side. Each army has a strenght track and is represented by a single counter on the map. Combat is resolved rolling a die per player, with various modifiers.

Alexander must conquer most of the Persian Empire and India before turn 14 to gain a decisive victory. A minor victory can be achieved by conquering Egypt instead.

--user summary

Published on "Guerre e Guerrieri" magazine, issue #37.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: Wars of Alexander the Great

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: 5 Surprise Mini Brands!: Mini Market Dash! Game
boardgame.description:
Get ready to dash! Race around the market using one of the Mini Brands Collectable movers, gathering all the Mini Brands you can. Complete your cart to collect them all!

—description from the back of the box

The game is based on a series of collectible miniatures based on actual brand name items, four of which are included to use as pawns representing the players. Players also receive three cards representing a shopping list, with three food items on each. On your turn, you roll a single die (d6) and move that amount around the board. If a space has a face-down token it is revealed, and if it is an item you need you can pick it up and put it on your list (it stays on the space if not). There are also a few "wild" tokens that can used for any item. Other spaces let you draw from a deck of cards with a variety of actions, including stealing tokens from an opponent's list. Complete a list and you get another, and the first player to complete three lists wins. Any token from a completed list is put in the center and can be collected if a player lands on an empty space; as such, the game picks up pace as it goes on as more items are readily available.

boardgame.name: House of Cronies
boardgame.description:
To play House of Cronies, each player’s Cabinet consists of up to 6 cronies; each carrying a set number of votes, plus an optional foreign ally. All cronies, besides the foreign allies, can be elected as president or vice-president. Other positions such as Finance, Justice, Service Delivery and Communications, can only be filled by specialists.

Two decks of cards are placed on the table: the main deck and the tactics deck. The main deck consists of influence, corruption and crony cards and the tactics deck contains only tactics cards. Players start with seven cards from the main deck and two tactic cards each. Any cronies or foreign ally in the initial hand must be placed in the cabinet immediately (and any crony or ally that can not be placed is discarded).

In each round of House of Cronies, five cards are drawn from the main deck and placed face up in the middle of the table. In turn order, players can either pick up an influence / corruption card OR bid influence, corruption or a combination of both for a crony. Players can only gain one card per round, so any player who outbids another forfeits their turn. Players that are outbid, get their turn and their influence / corruption bid card back.

The end of the game occurs when there are no cards left in the deck or fewer cards than needed to draw for a new round. A final round is played for players to buy and used tactics before the election takes place and the player with the most votes wins!

boardgame.name: The Chosen Ones
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

You always knew you were different. From birth, there was something inside of you that set you apart from everyone else, a sign that you were destined for greatness. And so it was not entirely shocking when you got a little older, and discovered who you really were: the Chosen One, the hero spoken of in The Prophecy. What was more unexpected was when you arrived at the legendary training complex, you found several others like you, each with an equally valid claim to being the Chosen One...

The Chosen Ones is a 3-5 player TTRPG about a group of Chosen Ones all given the same prophecy, deciding whether they want to work together to save the world, or fight to be crowned the true Chosen One. You establish what abilities you share, what makes you unique, and how long your quest takes. All the while, you’ll pursue dangerous tasks and villainous threats which will usher you ever closer to your ultimate destinies.

Based on Lasers and Feelings by John Harper. The Chosen Ones is typically a multi-session game, featuring a progress clock à la Blades in the Dark (also by John Harper), and a roll tally inspired by War in the Year 3000 by Ben Roswell.

boardgame.name: Battle Boosts
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gear Up!

Improving your gear is a key part of advancing in power and effectiveness for your Starfinder character, and you'll find an incredible array of new options right here to enhance your armaments as well as improving your character's feats! Try out 15 fantastic new gear boosts like suited swagger, wartime boots, flag bearer, and hyper thrust! Better still, you can enhance half a dozen combat feats with new feat boosts like Reckless Aim to enhance Deadly Aim, Cry Wolf for Advance Warning, and Burly Takedown for Improved Combat Maneuver!

boardgame.name: Republic of Tharda (Revised)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Thardic Republic is a large, prosperous nation in western Hârn. Unique among the Hârnic realms, it is neither a feudal nor tributary monarchy but a plutocratic state governed by a republican senate. It is seen by many as a descendent of the mighty Corani Empire.

The Republic is dominated by a few dozen clans who have parlayed agricultural and commercial wealth into status and position. Bureaucracies of civil servants manage the daily affairs of government, with rival families vying for influence when new appointments are made. Conflicts of interest are common and the resulting system of government has been described as both incredibly selfish and surprisingly functional.

Unlike other Hârnic realms, the Republic has a standing army. Its legions keep order and defend against foreign aggression. It is also uncommonly tolerant in matters of religion. Public worship of almost all gods is legal and adherents of many faiths coexist in society, although not always peacefully. The Church of Halea is more prevalent and powerful here than elsewhere on Hârn.

Tharda is rich in natural resources and exports considerable amounts of high-quality stone and salt. Slaves are a significant element in the economy. Some fight as gladiators in the Pamesani Games or serve as pleasure slaves or household servants, but most toil on the estates of the ruling families.

The Republic is bordered by the kingdoms of Kanday and Rethem. Relations with both are presently peaceful but tense. Two tribal nations range along the frontier: the ruthless Tulwyn and the wary, often violent Gozyda.

The Republic of Tharda module is supplemented by other Columbia Games publications, including castles, keeps, atlas maps, and adventure sites that provide a variety of opportunities for role-playing enjoyment.

boardgame.name: Highfane Peaks
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Highfane Peaks is a setting toolkit designed to help you build evocative adventures in a mythological mountain range.

A 70+ page setting guide for Five Torches Deep
Detailed mountaineering rules
New lineages, classes, spells, monsters, and equipment
Guidelines on adventuring in an arcanely-drenched mountain range
High concept: what if dungeons were on mountain peaks instead of underground?


Five Torches Deep: Highfane Peaks is a compact compendium of rugged climbs and ancient magic. Here's a quick summary of its key elements:

Old-school plus 5e. Highfane Peaks is built for Five Torches Deep, the best selling OSR minded 5e hack. As such it works with just about any fantasy adventure game that uses a d20. While there are a few widgets that specifically cater to FTD, the majority of the book is a collection of tools and tables to help create adventures in a sorcerous mountain range.

A setting of aberrant temples carved atop magically-birthed mountains. A long-dead progenitor people known as the Shapers created the eponymous range at the edge of the world. Some say that these peaks are where all life began; others that it is a foul place haunted by the sins of careless mages. Dig into dozens of pages of spells, monsters, loot, adventure hooks, and people in our typical concise style all designed to fit within an evocative setting.

New rules for mountain-based adventures. New lineages, classes, equipment, and subsystems to make ascents feel like a hazardous trial of mountaineering rather than a quick montage of exposition. Play as the bizarre clayfolk constructs left behind by the Shapers, tame an infamously agile rockgoat to be your loyal steed, and try to avoid being conscripted into the ghost armies of the aurorawyrms that rule the night skies.

boardgame.name: Sword Noir (Second Edition)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Imagine a barbarian prince embroiled in the criminal underworld of a cosmopolitan city as they seek for an artifact in the shape of a falcon statue. Consider two accomplished thieves—one an urbane duelist and the other a brawny skald—hired by a wealthy retired general to deal with a blackmailer, only uncover multiple murders tied to the general’s children. Envision hardboiled crime fiction in the worlds of sword & sorcery.

That’s Sword Noir.

The concept of Sword Noir is a combination of hardboiled fiction, the film noir it inspired, and sword & sorcery. The setting is noir while the characters are drawn from sword & sorcery tales. The PCs live in a world filled with injustice and apathy. Treachery and greed dominate and hope is frail. Violence is deadly and fast. The characters are good at what they do. They are specialists. Trust is the most valued of commodities—life is the cheapest. Grim leaders weave labyrinthine plots which entangle innocents. Magic is real and can be powerful, but it takes extreme dedication to learn, extorts a horrible price, and is slow to conjure.

Now is the time for your characters to walk down mean streets, drenched in rain, hidden in fog, and unravel mysteries, murders, and villainy.

boardgame.name: Das große "Oh wie schön ist Panama" Spiel
boardgame.description:
Each player is given a piece to roll to Panama and back as quickly as possible. On the way there are special fields on which you have to test your memory by revealing the matching tile to the field you have reached. If none of the 3 revealed tiles is correct, you have to travel back to the next special field. The first player to return home (after reaching Panama) wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Kheufer Scrolls (Second Edition)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s the stuff that nightmares are made of.

A strange cargo has entered the city of Everthorn. These ancient scrolls tied to a mythical necromancer have drawn many to them, some seeking power, some seeking wealth, and some simply seeking to slake their curiosity. You are drawn for another reason. That doesn’t matter—all of you are deceived. When is anything ever what it appears to be on its face? Someone is playing a game, and no one knows who’s the player or who’s the played.

With you caught caught right in the middle.

The Kheufer Scrolls is a 64-page PDF presenting an adventure for Sword Noir: A Role-Playing Game of Hardboiled Sword & Sorcery (Second Edition) for two to six starting characters. The adventure includes six pre-generated characters. While the adventure does not require the use of Sword Noir, the narrative characters and some situations are based on that system and would require modification to use with another.

boardgame.name: There Once Were Dragons Ultimate Hoard
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unearth treasures beyond your wildest dreams! This accessory for There Once Were Dragons, the roleplaying game of epic fantasy action, introduces more than 120 new magical items for your campaigns.

Petrify your enemies with a Basilisk's Revenge shield.
Enhance your magic with an Elder Wizardry ring.
Scorch the battlefield with lava from a Sleeping God warhammer.
And many, many more to suit every character and every strategy!

No swords +1 or rings of protection. Each item comes with a table capable of generating many random variants so that you will never have to find the same thing twice.

boardgame.name: The Bestial Soul
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Prestige Class for 5E from the Realm Scribe!

The bestial soul becomes a beast in the throws of the life and death struggle of survival. When they become a beast, they enter into a primal rage and fight as though death is the only option for them if they lose. As they become more in-tune with the power of nature, they learn to infuse their druidic magic into their fury, casting it instinctually.

This class is for high-level campaigns that allow for multi-classing in order for a character to meet the requirements for this Prestige Class. It is designed to fuse together the idea of a raging barbarian with a shapeshifting druid, and requires high wisdom and strength, levels in both the barbarian and druid classes, and to be at least 10th level before taking a level in this class. Prestige Classes are very powerful and meant for high threat campaigns.

Included in this product are the rules for Prestige Classes (as imagined by the Realm Scribe), the class, and 5 new Beasts between CR 3 and CR 7 (these beasts are also included in The Evolutionist Prestige Class).

boardgame.name: October 2021
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to this month’s compilation of Studio M—’s Patreon! October celebrated the spooky season, focusing on undead, fleshwarping, and necromancy! This book features an expansion to the Death sphere, featuring new talents, feats, traits, magic items and drawbacks, new spells and magic items for vancian casters, new fleshcrafts, new fleshwarp veils, as well as an expansion to the newly released Promethean, an akashic class I wrote for Lost Spheres Publishing that you can pick up now!

boardgame.name: November 2021
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to this month’s compilation of Studio M—’s Patreon! November expanded on the recently released Soulforge with a number of new archetypes for it, including Spheres of Akasha support, added a new akashic species that draws upon the lingering influence of a Daevic pact upon their bloodline called the Avead, and added a number of new feats and veils!

boardgame.name: Schermstrijd
boardgame.description:
Schermstrijd is a family game. Children battle against their parents to gain more screentime! It's a simple card game in which you try to duplicate the colored wifi-code laid out in the center of the table. Sabotage your opponents and be the first to complete your code to win the game!

The game is played in 3 to 5 rounds (you can choose). Set a starting time and roll the dice to see how much screentime can be added or extracted.
4 colored wifi-card are layed out in the center in the beginning of the round. The first player to duplicate the code wins the round.

During a turn you roll a dice to see what actions you may perform. This can vary from stealing a card to changing the code in the center. You play cards to complete your code or to prevent your opponents to complete theirs.

Schermstrijd the battle is a fun and easy family game to end discussions about, well... screentime. In only 30 minutes of offline fun it is settled. Do you dare to battle?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Arcane Virtuosos
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore the Arcanist Archetype with a host of new options

The Arcanist is the archetype in Newtonium Engine that focuses on ritual magic. They seek to master a wide and powerful array of spells and rituals to overcome their enemies and make their mark upon the world.

This book provides a host of new options for the Arcanist archetype, including...

Four new sub-archetypes,
twelve new talents,
fifteen new rituals,
a selection of example ways to use the skill action system to explore more subtle uses of magic
four pregenerated characters

boardgame.name: Attack of the Cleaning Robots?!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Attack of the Cleaning Robots?! is a 20 page beginner's adventure for Mutants and Masterminds designed to be played at PL6 or PL8. This is an all-encompassing adventure with detailed explanations of the game's mechanics. Attack of the Cleaning Robots?! is the perfect adventure for getting a new party invested in your campaign.

Includes:

Three act storyline
Character sheets for the main villian, minions, and the climatic boss fight
Comments and suggestions on how to connect the story to your characters/campaign
Detailed instructions on the gameplaying process

boardgame.name: Monster Villains Vol.1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It will be a graveyard smash with Rogues Gallery: Monster Villains Vol. 1! This book is a supplement for Mutants and Masterminds 3rd Edition that provides GameMasters and Players with 3 pre-made Villains for their Horror Campaign: Countess Ladislava, The Beast, and Charnel. Play them right out of the box, or use them as inspiration for your own campaigns.

Includes:

3 Detailed character sheets with artwork and explanations of how to play them
How a GM might include the characters in their campaigns
5 Plot Hooks that can be used to build sessions, including a 'finale' hook to tie your campaigns together into arcs inspired by comics.

boardgame.name: Mutant Villains Vol. 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What side will you take in the battle for Mutantdom? Rogues Gallery: Mutant Villains Vol. 1 is a supplment for Mutants and Masterminds 3rd Edition that provides GameMasters and Players with 3 pre-made Villains for their Mutant Campaign: Mother Superior, Fearmonger, and Dr. Tiberius Candor. Play them right out of the box, or use them as inspiration for your own campaigns.

Includes:

3 Detailed character sheets with artwork and explanations of how to play them
How a GM might include the characters in their campaigns
5 Plot Hooks that can be used to build sessions, including a 'finale' hook to tie your campaigns together into arcs inspired by comics.

boardgame.name: Mutant Heroes Vol. 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the world fears you, will you step up an become a Hero? Rogues Gallery: Mutants Vol. 1 is a supplment for Mutants and Masterminds 3rd Edition that provides GameMasters and Players with 3 pre-made Heroes for their Mutant Campaign: Tempe, Lodestone, and Kid Kamazotz. Play them right out of the box, or use them as inspiration for your own custom characters.

Includes:

3 Detailed character sheets with artwork and explanations of how to play them
How a GM might include the characters in their campaigns
Information on how to convert the characters from PL6 Heroes in-training to PL8 adult Heroes

boardgame.name: Street Villains Vol. 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a crime wave hits your city, will your Heroes be able to stop it? Rogues Gallery: Street-Level Villains Vol. 1 is a supplment for Mutants and Masterminds 3rd Edition that provides GameMasters and Players with 3 pre-made Villains for their Street-Level Campaign: The Clown, Hush Hush, and Chrome Dome. Inside comes with 3 playable Villains with detailed character sheets, and information on how to best apply them to your own campaign. Play them right out of the box, or use them as inspiration for your own custom characters.

boardgame.name: Cosmic Villains Vol. 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What side will you take in the battle for Mutantdom? Rogues Gallery: Mutant Villains Vol. 1 is a supplment for Mutants and Masterminds 3rd Edition that provides GameMasters and Players with 3 pre-made Villains for their Cosmic Campaign: Captain Ivero, Event Horizon, and Stratvarius Da'asti. Play them right out of the box, or use them as inspiration for your own campaigns.

Includes:

3 Detailed character sheets with artwork and explanations of how to play them
How a GM might include the characters in their campaigns
5 Plot Hooks that can be used to build sessions, including a 'finale' hook to tie your campaigns together into arcs inspired by comics.

boardgame.name: Mini-Eventures II (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Even the smallest town has more locations than all but the most diligent and time-rich GM could ever hope to detail and design. To make matters even worse, when an adventuring party gets to a town or city, the characters often have the irritating habit of going off exploring. What’s a GM to do? Designed specifically for you, the busy GM, the mini-eventures herein help you bring depth and flavour to your characters’ next urban adventure. This compilation is designed for use with City Backdrop: Languard, but can be easily used in virtually any town or city.

This compilation presents 12 mini-eventures.

boardgame.name: Galaktion: Messengers of the Void
boardgame.description:
Galaktion: Messengers of the Void is a tactical co-op sci-fi story-driven dungeon crawler game for 2-5 players, with an option for solo play.

The game will take you to the far future of the Milky way, where a team of renegades are hired by a shadowy corporation to fix a messy experiment with galactic proportions.

Unique setting, armed with tight game rules, allows you to “learn-as-you-crawl” through the dungeon maps and master your strategy against the game. Randomly spawned enemies and skill based characters will allow you to choose from variety of skills and abilities to find your best game style cooperating with your team mates. In Galaktion: Messengers of the Void, the team play means survival.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Holiday Spirits
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Christmas is cancelled! Unless the players can prove that Santa didn’t commit the theft that he is being accused of. When everyone’s favorite Mall Santa, Nicholas “Saint Nick” Boyd, gets arrested the week before Christmas, the owner of the Green Hills Mall hires the PCs to figure out what happened and to clear the Mall’s reputation.

Holiday Spirits is an example case for Grim Noir RPG. This booklet contains a self-contained adventure, example non-player characters and clues that the players will collect during the game.

The case file features:

A Christmas themes case to solve
Core clues for player characters to find
Map with clearly marked story locations
Lot's of Christmas spirit!

boardgame.name: Time Becomes a Narrow Door
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

NOTHING EXISTS WITHOUT CAUSE

A debt owed. A missing heir. A new cult rising in the desert. Trapped between an ageless prophecy and sensitive politics, a delicate path must be walked. What is the truth? With whom will you stand?

In Time Becomes A Narrow Door, the player characters are entrusted with the task of locating the missing heir of an allied House. They must travel to a pyon village beyond the relative safety of Arrakeen, but where the situation is no less complex. Navigating the fine line between ethics and duty may prove difficult, but nothing on Arrakis is easy.

This stand-alone 20-page PDF adventure for Dune - Adventures in the Imperium is a great introduction to some of the core elements at the heart of the game. With multiple possible outcomes depending on player character decisions, Time Becomes A Narrow Door is designed to encourage roleplaying difficult choices.

boardgame.name: Pagius Book of Spells Volume 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Pagius Book of Spells Volume 2 is a Hero Kids compatible expansion that adds more Spellcasting to your Hero Kids adventure.

boardgame.name: Reef of Memories
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Off the coast of Bailey's Point exists a spot in the sea where ships have been sinking under no apparent reason. Survivors are plenty, but they all have the same stories. The ship got holes from one moment to the next, and after that they had little time to abandon it as it was sinking fast. Some even have stories of sea creatures dragging survivors underwater, never to be seen again.

Furthermore, some 3 months ago, colorful corals have been spotted extremely close to the coast at Bailey's Point, as if a giant coral reef has been expanding towards the land. These are covered in a slimy mucus that puzzles researchers, as they don't seem to perish when above water.

Could the two things be connected? And if so, what could be causing the shipwrecks and the coral expansion?

Reef of Memories is the 8th adventure released by Adventure Bundles. We are content creators for 5e and release monthly adventures and encounters for it.

With this adventure you get:

Adventure PDF
1 underwater dungeon map
printable PDF with many versions of the map(grid, gridless, printer friendly)
3 items as printable item cards

boardgame.name: Twisted Final Fights
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Twisted Final Fights is a supplement for Four Against Darkness bringing variety to Final Boss encounters.

Using a d100 table, you will encounter frightening Final Bosses such as the Bewitched Armor, the Baalran Scourgemaster, the Ettin Adventurer, Akerbeltz’ Bellbringer, the Mutant Houndling, the Abyssal Eye-Maw, the Three-eyed Mutant, the Lich Sigilist, the Corrupted Swamp Elemental, and many more… Features:

48 Final Bosses that scale up with the power of your party;

A d66 Table for Weird Treasure;

Rules for the Enchanted Homunculus, a weird creature that can join your party after you collect enough pieces to build it.

boardgame.name: MAKALOT
boardgame.description:
"The Different Game"

The game is promoted as "fast moving, surprising - different". It is played by four players on a 13x13 multi-coloured checkered board. On each side of the board, there is a role (producer, doctor, politician, and opportunist). One of these roles is assumed by each of the four players. Playing time is presented as being one to two hours. The board also states that the game is "a game of skill", played with "no dice or cards".

MAKALOT was published by Modern Games Company in Oaktown, Indiana. The copyright date is 1937, held by Roy A. Beard. A "patent pending" notation is shown on the game board.

boardgame.name: Waste Knights: Second Edition – Beyond the Horizon
boardgame.description:
Beyond the Horizon is a massive expansion for Waste Knights: Second Edition, a postapocalyptic game of adventure and survival. Now is the time to leave the continent, embark upon a ship and sail to places you only know from legends and myths.

Explore a new map enabling you to visit Tasmania, Solomon Islands or New Zealand altered by the Apocalypse. Learn the truth behind the infamous Project X, while battling deadly sea monsters and experiencing strange weather phenomena.
Seek for fresh water – a new resource that will make the game even more realistic and challenging both for sea-farers and continent dwellers.

Play as one of new Knights armed with unique abilities and expand your base game using tens of new cards, tokens, and adventures to experience a setting of enormous proportions however you like – solo, cooperatively or competitively.

Choose your ship, set the course and see where the winds shall take you!

-description from publisher

boardgame.description:
Random Events
Issue 31

boardgame.name: Random Events (Issue 24 - Jul 1982)
boardgame.description:
Random Events
Issue 24
