boardgame.name: Random Events (Issue 23 - Jun 1982)
boardgame.description:
Random Events
Issue 23
June 1982

boardgame.name: Caveosaurus Dinos
boardgame.description:
A rampaging herd of dinosaurs are circling a peaceful cave village. Located far out in the dusty desert plains, the village's only defence against the prehistoric invaders are their very own Clyde, Charlie, Chester & Chuck. Rallying together throughout the night, can the brave team chase off the Caveosaurus Dinos?

A fast paced co-operative card game for 1 to 4 players with a game length of 15 minutes. On a players turn they will draw two cards from the deck and will choose to play one and discard the other. Cards will allow a players caveman to move around the village circle of caves, send in an enemy dino, rotate the attack spear or hopefully chase off a dino.

Once a day and night has been played the team of cavemen can add up their total score for points awarded for chasing dinos, caves protected and if they returned to their home caves.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Random Events (Issue 22 - May 1982)
boardgame.description:
Random Events
Issue 22
May 1982

boardgame.name: Bossa (坊茶)
ぼっさ
坊茶(ぼっさ)
boardgame.description:
In Bossa (坊茶) (ぼっさ), two players compete to play each of the tiles from their hand. The tiles show the traditional dice faces, 1 through 6, in various combinations of white and black pips. If a tile shows 5 pips, but 2 are white and 3 are black, it is treated as a 2 white or a 3 black, but it will never be used as a 5.

At the start of the game, the players roll two dice, one with black pips and one with white pips. The players extend a virtual row, in both directions, from these dice. For instance, if the black pipped dice is a 6, the players are looking to play tile(s) of value 5 to one side, and 7 to the other.

In addition to drawing and playing tile(s) each turn, the players have a few special abilities that can be triggered once per game.

The first person to play all of the tiles from their hand wins.
user summary

The publisher says:
A simple yet stylish game of tactics, strategy and a little luck for 2 players. Following either the dice with white pips or black pips, place the tile with the same colored dots alongside the dice.

Utilizing the three action cards offensively, defensively or to turn the tables, use up all the tiles in your hand before your opponent to win!

Using both the tiles in your hand and the pile, read the play, exploit the action cards, and with the luck of the draw, seize victory!

There are two types of rules: the Basic Rules, which are easy to play with, and the Advanced Rules, which are more thoughtful and fun to play with.
boardgame.boardgamedesigner: Banana Moon Studio Sapporo (バナナムーン･ステュディオ)
boardgame.boardgameartist: Banana Moon Studio Sapporo (バナナムーン･ステュディオ)
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Banana Moon Studio Sapporo (バナナムーン･ステュディオ)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Sweets in Wonderland
boardgame.description:
Sweets in Wonderland is a trick-taking game where players draft the conditions of each trick, aiming to achieve the most points.

Specifically, players draft if the trick will be must-follow or can't-follow for a randomly revealed un-dealt card, and if high cards will win or low cards. Players may also play 1 or 2 cards on their turn.

The winner of a trick wins the chips used for drafting the round conditions, and the start player for the draft rotates.

At the end of the game, the player with the most points, determined through a set collection mechanic with the drafting chips, wins.

boardgame.name: One Day at a Thyme
boardgame.description:
From the itch.io page:

One Day at a Thyme is a cozy, whimsical solo journaling game in which you play the inhabitant of a cottage in a magical world.

All you need is a six-sided die, a standard deck of playing cards, and of course, a journal and something to write with.

boardgame.name: Golazo: Managers Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
The Managers Expansion Pack comes with cards that add ten managers to the game.

Each of the Golazo Managers has 3 special abilities to give you an advantage over your opponent! Choose your manager at the start of the game. You can only use each card once, so use them wisely!

Note: each of the 10 managers has their own special ability cards that are different from those of the other managers.

boardgame.name: Blackfog
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Transport your game to the era of Gaslight!

What is Blackfog?

Blackfog is perhaps the defining feature of the Fourth Age and the Gaslight era of the Midlands around Lake Argosa; certainly its arrival changed the Third Age world as the inhabitants knew it. However, while it is native to that setting, there is no reason it cannot be imported to any campaign world.

It resembles a normal fog but darker, like coal smoke though it is perfectly breathable. It impedes vision and light like a normal fog, but its true danger is what it brings. Blood. Madness. Terror. Rending. Death. It brings Them.

Blackfog is a tool for GMS to create uncertainty and horror. It never presents the same challenges twice, keeping PCs a little off-balance. It might even make them afraid of the dark...

boardgame.name: Mother Medusa
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mother Medusa is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for three to five characters of 5th level.

An archeologist exposes ancient dangers.
A snake cult slithers from the depths.
While a voice cries among unwanted worshippers.
Can you prevent a tragic ending to a tale centuries in the making?

Crosshead Studios presents Mother Medusa, an adventure in which a group of heroes will receive a cry for help from a town under siege. Nightly attacks and abductions have left the people there desperate and an archeologist seems to be to blame. The heroes must travel to ancient underground ruins, battle venomous snake folk and their brainwashed servants, and confront a troubled princess who might be the key to either saving or destroying the entire region.

Features

Original Art By Crosshead This module isn't just a pdf but also includes JPG handouts of all the maps, tokens and magic items featured in this adventure.
Multiple Maps This adventure features multiple maps, including a massive 28 x 88 map of the Medusa Sanctuary.
Easy Customization The adventure can be used as a stand alone one-two shot adventure or is easily adapted into an existing campaign.

boardgame.name: Baphomet Abandoned
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

PANDEMONIUM!

Welcome to Baphomet Abandoned, a one-shot adventure developed concurrently by Crosshead and Swampland Games! This adventure is appropriate for 3-5 level 9 adventurers and should take approximately 3-4 hours to play.

"Baphomet Abandoned" is a 9th level one-shot by Crosshead & Swampland Games
New magic items and creatures designed by Swampland and illustrated by Crosshead
Inspired by community input on Crosshead's social
Maps hand-drawn and designed by Crosshead for DungeonDraw

boardgame.name: Slash & Spells
boardgame.description:
How will you build your Victory?

Slash & Spells is a Hero Building Battleground. Embody your Legendary Hero and unlock your unique ability tokens using magical Relics across the realm. Command clever card play and take ever-evolving heroic actions.

Slash & Spells is an epic duel using action selection, variable player powers, and hero tech trees tied into your relic choices. Players control unique Heroes drawn into an epic battle during your turn you take 6 basic actions to grow in power, attack, move, play cards from your unique hero deck, and ultimately knock down your enemies by reducing their health to zero.

The battle takes place via attack actions and playing cards from your hand. Each card that resolves deals their base Dmg and card effects to their target. Once a card has been played its card effect becomes an available action for your hero to take.

Victory is yours when you claim the most Knockdowns by the end of rounds and can claim your true destiny!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Minotaur
boardgame.description:
You have dared to enter the labyrinth, only to find that the maze changes with almost every step you take. The way out has been sealed off, and the Minotaur patrols these halls, called to the magic of the medallions and those who might steal them.

Even if you defeat it in combat, the magic of the labyrinth keeps the beast alive. Your only hope is to assemble the medallions and use their power to seal the Minotaur for good. Will you be able to stop the invincible Minotaur before it hunts you down?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Machine
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The curse snuck up on you, and now you can’t escape. You’re not sure how or when it began, but every waking moment, you feel the machine call to you.

Behind its words are music, beckoning you to build. The impossible notes echo in your mind, and you know what you must do. You can see it now, this manifold instrument.

You will complete this infernal machine or die trying.

boardgame.name: Stampede
boardgame.description:
Stampede is a set-collection auction game themed around stamp collecting.

On a player's turn, they reveal 1 to 4 cards from a prepared deck to auction. The players then choose how many dice to roll. The player who rolls the highest amount is the winner, but will pay the value of the second highest amount rolled. The players pay their bids in dice, with each 6 coins (pips) they need to pay consuming 1 of their dice.

The end of the game is triggered once a certain card is revealed near the bottom of the deck. The player with the most points from the cards they've collected wins.

boardgame.name: Hatoful Boyfriend: MIRROR
はーとふる彼氏MIRROR
boardgame.description: MIRROR will take place in a completely separate timeline where Hiyoko's parents don't die, and thus with a butterfly effect, many tragedies of the canon story don't take place. Nageki and Kazuaki-kun will be alive, as well as Hitori and the remaining Heartful House orphans.

boardgame.name: Tehuatl Pathfinder Bestiary
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A short bestiary of monsters from The Lost Lands, Tehuatl, for Pathfinder.

boardgame.name: By This Axe I Hack!
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Before the dawn of recorded history, our world was a primeval landscape dotted with pockets of civilization; kingdoms, nations, and city-states surrounded by a vast and unforgiving wilderness teaming with danger and littered with the fallen ruins of an ancient empire of mighty sorcerer-lords and the remnants of older, darker civilizations.

Based on David Black’s game-changing The Black Hack, By This Axe I Hack takes its cues from Robert E. Howard’s Conan the Barbarian and Kull of Atlantis, Roy Thomas and Barry Windsor Smith’s Red Sonja, Michael Moorcock’s Elric of Melnibone, and Fritz Leiber’s Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser.

By This Axe I Hack includes 18 unique Character Classes (6 warriors, 6 rogues, and 6 magicians), a magic system with 120 spells tailored to the sword and sorcery genre, over 70 special features to customize your Characters, rules for modifying existing Character Classes or creating your own, a huge assortment of men and monsters to throw at your Players, a number of optional rules to help you fine tune the game to exactly your liking, and a variety of random tables to help Gamemasters create their own Lost Age.

boardgame.name: By This Axe Companion
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Expanding on the material presented in By This Axe I Hack, the By This Axe Companion includes 12 new Character Classes (4 warriors, 4 rogues, and 4 magicians), 6 new backgrounds for each, 72 new spells designed for the sword and sorcery genre, and 26 new special features to make your Character unique, plus a host of new rules and options, including new combat rules, weapon rules, wealth rules, wilderness rules, runeblade powers, and a collection of relics and artifacts for GMs who want to incorporate magic items into their games.

Although designed primary to supplement By This Axe I Hack and other roleplaying games based on the Black Hack, most of the material in this book is relatively OSR compatible and should be easy to modify for use with any version of the world’s most popular fantasy roleplaying game.

Based on David Black’s game-changing The Black Hack, By This Axe I Hack takes its cues from Robert E. Howard’s Conan the Barbarian and Kull of Atlantis, Roy Thomas and Barry Windsor Smith’s Red Sonja, Michael Moorcock’s Elric of Melnibone, and Fritz Leiber’s Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser.

boardgame.name: A Treatise on Espruar
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A field study of the Elven language in the Forgotten Realms.

boardgame.name: Pierniczki
boardgame.description:
Master Caramel's pastry shop is famous for the most delicious gingerbread. It gets so many orders that the master is no longer able to fulfill them on his own, so he asked you for help, which is a very responsible task! Each gingerbread must have the right shape, plenty of icing and the right sprinkles. Those of you, who deal with your tasks as quickly as possible, will surely fall into the favors of Master Caramel... and get a pot of icing to lick off! So get to work!

Pierniczki (The Gingerbread) is a game that combines the element of memory with matching shapes and colors, which is why it is perfect for the youngest children.

—description from the publisher

Cukiernia mistrza Karmela słynie z najpyszniejszych pierniczków. Spływa do niej tyle zamówień, że mistrz nie jest już w stanie ich samodzielnie zrealizować, więc poprosił Was o pomoc.To bardzo odpowiedzialne zadanie! Każdy pierniczek musi mieć odpowiedni kształt, dużo lukru i odpowiednią posypkę. To z Was, które najszybciej upora się ze swoimi zadaniami na pewno wkradnie się w łaski mistrza Karmela... i dostanie garnek lukru do wylizania! Zatem do dzieła!

Gra Pierniczki łączy w sobie element zapamiętywania, dopasowywania kształtów i kolorów dlatego idealnie sprawdzi się wśród najmłodszych dzieci.

—description from the publisher (Polish)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Mythika: The Olympians
boardgame.description:
The world is new, and fledgling civilizations beseech you for aid. In this 2-4 player game, you will assume the role of a Greek God vying for control of the world and the future of your civilization. Wield divine power using asymmetric abilities and your customizable action deck. There are 13 Gods to choose from, providing a different challenge and experience each time you play.

As a God you exercise your will, represented by various cards and abilities, to build the world as you play. On your turn you will play cards and pay for their scalable effects by exhausting your civilization’s cities and temples. New cities and temples can be built when your population grows, making your action cards more powerful and your turns more efficient. You’ll be able to shape the shared world map as players choose which unique hex-shaped land tiles to add, giving the mortals new areas to grow into. Each land has its own mix of geographic type, attack and defense bonus, population growth rate, potential build sites, movement cost, and location abilities. No two worlds will look the same. You will also guide your Hero and High Priestess to go on quests, use location abilities on land tiles, lead your people to new areas, or convert the non-believers. There are also 12 powerful mythological creatures that can be summoned, each with their own abilities to enhance your strategy.

As powerful as you are, the mortals are not entirely within your control as they have their own free will. They will pray for various signs, protections, or resources, and answering these prayers will grant you a range of benefits in return. In addition, at the end of each player's turn the population will move and grow in response to the Mortal die's result.

The game ends after 3 Ages of raising mountains, answering prayers, causing catastrophes, unlocking technologies, warring, and building cities, temples, and monuments. Victory points are awarded for area control of the world, your completed quests and world-building secret objectives, technological discoveries, military victories, Follower's morale, and other achievements. Each God also has their own way to earn VP. The god with the most VP takes their rightful seat on Mount Olympus.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Kanzleramt
boardgame.description:
Nowhere are the opposites of good and evil more evident than in politics. And in this board game.

Honest, committed and capable rulers oppose lying, cheating and scheming fellow citizens. In the struggle for power in the role of Chancellor / Chancelloress, some people will use any means.
As a member of politics, you must assert yourself in this - often unfriendly - environment and also be able to deal with unfair means of competition in order to decide the question of the next Chancellor for yourself.
Based on real political events, you will experience this tension and all these contradictions in Kanzleramt.
Your path to the chancellor's office is long and rocky, and it always leads through the Bundestag. It is important that you get as many members of your own party as possible into the Bundestag. Because in this parlor game they elect the chancellor at the end.

As in real life, the path to this position is practically never straightforward and is marked by both positive surprises and setbacks. Luck, skill, fighting spirit and a wide variety of political events influence the path of your party's politicians to the Bundestag.

—description from the publisher (translated)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Trains of Europe
boardgame.description:
On a map of Europe, you build track to fulfill your contracts.
On his turn, each of the players chooses one of 6 action phases and triggers it. All players act while the triggering player has an advantage (like in Puerto Rico). In the contract phase, you choose contracts that include a start city, a destination city and sometimes 1 or 2 in between. It says which type of locomotive you are allowed to use and which and how many wagons.

In the building phase, you connect any 2 cities by paying for the track you build. In the market phase you buy locomotives and wagons, in the auction phase you must offer at least one locomotive or wagon that is not yet part of a contract. In the reward phase, you get money for your connected cities and in the state subsidy phase you receive a locomotive or wagon for free. At the end of a round all players receive income according to their partly or completely fulfilled contracts.

After a player has an agreed amount of fulfilled contracts, the game ends and you get points for fulfilled contracts, income and connected cities and minus points for contracts not at least partly fulfilled.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Rush Wars
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world of Rush Wars is an alternate universe where cars have an even greater importance than in our world. They are both an identity and a conduit for power. Those esteemed few who can tap into a car’s true potential become Heroes and Villains the likes of which haven’t been seen since the Trojan War.

This book contains:

An examination of what Beam Saber looks like in settings that are close to the real world.
A list of suggested changes to consider when using Beam Saber in near real world campaigns.
The Tuner Pilot Playbook; a creatively obsessed driver. (Originally appears in The Growing Conflict)
Rules for how racing can work using Beam Saber.
A setting inspired by car focused, real world adjacent media such as the Fast & Furious series, the Saints Row series, and Speed Racer.

boardgame.name: Mini-Eventures II (OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Even the smallest town has more locations than all but the most diligent and time-rich GM could ever hope to detail and design. To make matters even worse, when an adventuring party gets to a town or city, the characters often have the irritating habit of going off exploring. What’s a GM to do? Designed specifically for you, the busy GM, the mini-eventures herein help you bring depth and flavour to your characters’ next urban adventure. This compilation is designed for use with City Backdrop: Languard, but can be easily used in virtually any town or city.

This compilation presents 12 mini-eventures.

boardgame.name: Valley of the Rock Baboons
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Valley of the Rock Baboons is another hex in the Rawhide Gang cluster. It features three dungeons (a mini-shrine to a baboon god, a brigand outpost, and the redoubt of a long-dead illusionist) as well as rules for creating animated objects, legendary weapons (magical items that grow more powerful along with the wielder) and a monk class for Old School Essentials or other similar games.

boardgame.name: Commercial Space Station Names
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Commercial Space Stations are everywhere. It is the only thing more comet dust getting into your engines. Every last one of those space stations needs a name and you can't keep using the name of the planet plus "Station." Give it something more evocative and interesting and have it right away with d66 Commercial Space Station Names.

14 Aurora Orbital Base
33 High Station Wealth
62 Starlandia

boardgame.name: Year Zero Nano
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Year Zero Nano (YZN) is an even lighter off-shoot of Year Zero Mini -- both of which are designed to provide lightweight frameworks for quickly jumping into your favourite setting.

Where other rules-light games might emphasise action or heroics, YZN is more down to earth - telling stories of a more gritty and relatable nature.

SIMPLE D6 DICE POOL SYSTEM
Using the Year Zero Engine as its basis (covered by an OGL from Free League Publishing), YZN uses a pool of standard six-sided dice, but differs slightly by looking for both 5s or 6s in the rolled dice pool.

SUITABLE FOR ONE-SHOTS OR CAMPAIGNS
While YZN is best experienced in one-shots, conventions, or short campaigns (around a dozen sessions), it's also suitable for longer-term play.

boardgame.name: Parkan 2
boardgame.description:
Parkan II is an original concept game that will allow you to feel as a pilot of a spacecraft lost somewhere in the universe. The players are to explore hundreds of solar systems, take part in a series of fierce battles and meet a new enemy - a mysterious creature calling itself Gegemaunt. Become a pirate or mercenary, get money to buy the most powerful cruiser and show them all who is to be the new master of the galaxy. Unforgettable adventures in the Parkan II universe await you!

Source: Publisher Blurb

boardgame.name: HackBots
boardgame.description:
HackBots is a strategic card game of sabotage for 2-5 players. The object of the game is to raise your opponents’ device risk and hack their devices before they hack you.

Each player lays out three Device Tokens in their playing area. Next, deal 4 cards face down to each player. Place the remaining deck face down to create the Draw Pile. Then, flip over the top card to start the Discard Pile.

On your turn, draw one card from the Draw Pile or Discard Pile. Play one card from your hand. You can ATTACK an opponent by raising the risk on one device, DEFEND one of your own devices by lowering or resetting the risk, or DISCARD one card if you cannot or do not want to play a card.

When a device’s risk reaches level 4, it may be hacked. Once a player has three hacked devices, that player cannot win the game. However, they remain in the game and continue to attack the remaining payers until there is a winner.

The last player remaining with at least one unhacked device wins the game!

boardgame.name: リカー・フォー・レディ (LIQUOR for LADY)
boardgame.description:
リカー・フォー・レディ (LIQUOR for LADY) is a 2 player card game from Japan. The theme has the players trying to buy the right cocktail for woman at a nightclub. Each player chooses a card in secret and reveals it simultaneously. If the difference between the values on the cards is more than 3, then the lower card wins (the lady liked the drink offered).

The player that favours the most woman at the bar is the winner.
user summary

boardgame.name: 子リスのほっぺ (Korisu no Hoppe)
boardgame.description:
子リスのほっぺ (Korisu no Hoppe) is a card game from Japan. Players are young squirrels, trying to collect acorns, but under the effect of action cards.
user summary

boardgame.name: Death Station
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Death Station is a remastering of a classic Traveller adventure, reimagined by Seth Skorkowsky.

High above a backwater world, the laboratory ship Calendula has gone silent. Believing it nothing more than a downed transmitter, the Travellers are sent to investigate. Inside they discover a grisly scene of corporate espionage, illegal medical experiments, betrayal, and murder. Worse yet, they are not alone. The only thing worse than the Calendula’s dead are the Calendula’s living… and they are hungry.

boardgame.name: Diamond Classes: The Brewmaster Barbarian
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Many dwarves are fond of their drink, but few go so far as to master the art of dwarven brewing. Those who do, go on to become brewmasters, experts in the art of creating, and more importantly, consuming their finely crafted brews.

Created with direct input from the winner of our Design-a-Book giveaway, we're happy to present the brewmaster barbarian.

So come on in and have a few, it's on us!

boardgame.name: The Bladesman
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Achieve combat mastery with special techniques.

The path of a Bladesman fighter is one of technical skill and prowess to bring out the most from the weapons they so gracefully wield. Though their forms may differ, this archetype encompasses a great many powerful warriors from across the multiverse under a similar skill set, from heroes of legend and noble knights to colossus slayers and demon hunters. Using the techniques passed down by these heroes, a Bladesman can prove to be a powerful combatant that can change the course of any battle through sheer force alone.

boardgame.name: The Hollowborn
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The only way to live is to consume life.

A Hollowborn is a sorcerer born from corruptive essences from dark rituals, vampiric beings, the meddlings of otherworldly entities of chaos, or any number of other reasons. Their birthright is that of corruption, their magic imbued with a deteriorating energy that consumes the life force of those it affects. More powerful Hollowborns can steal a portion of this life force and use it to improve themselves while their enemies writhe and decay; though once one of these sorcerers gets a taste for the power this grants, it swiftly becomes an insatiable hunger that they cannot help but feed.

boardgame.name: The Aggressor
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The best way to not be seen is to make sure there are no witnesses.

The Aggressor is a roguish archetype that embodies this concept in the most brutal of ways by scaring its opponents, chasing after them, and putting them out of their misery with a wide variety of weapons. While other rogues slink into the shadows and take to battle with swiftness, the Aggressor uses brute strength to show its true superiority in combat.

boardgame.name: The Marksman
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Marksman is a roguish archetype specializing in ranged combat, showing extreme proficiency in their craft through the use of several trained firing techniques special to their breed of rogue. Be it with a longbow, rifle, crossbow, or other orthodox weapons, the Marksman proves and improves the effectiveness of fighting at range to the highest degree.

boardgame.name: Entreaty of Eldritch Enchanters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this Four Against Darkness supplement for all levels of play, you will discover many new character classes of a magical nature: Ash Bride, Battlemage, Dilettante, Dragonkin, Elementalist, Fakir, Frost Maiden, Greater Familiar, Greater Griffin, Knight of Neutrality, Living Relic, Magman, Mudman, Oracle, Psion, Scarecrow, Specialist, Sylph, Undine.

Also included are new spells and psionic skills.

boardgame.name: Stalingrad '42 Expansion: Operation Little Saturn and Winter Storm
boardgame.description:
A small expansion for Mark Simonitch's Stalingrad '42 which adds an additional scenario covering the period from December 14th, 1942 through February 5th, 1943. The scenario portrays the Soviet Little Saturn offensive following up on Operation Uranus, against the German allies of Romania and Italy. The German forces attempt at the same time to break the Soviet encirclement of the 6th Army with Operation Winter Storm. Counters are provided for the Soviet Ostrogozhsk-Rossosh Operation against the Italians and Hungarians, the Voronezh-Kastornoe Operation against 2nd Army, and the final offensive against Stalingrad, Operation Ring.

Contents
1 8-page Little Saturn/Winter Storm Booklet
1 half-countersheet for Little Saturn/Winter Storm
1 Axis Setup card
1 Soviet Setup card
1 updated Stalingrad ‘42 Rules Booklet
2 updated Stalingrad ‘42 Player Aid Cards

boardgame.name: Mal kurz die Welt ändern: Promokarten – Deutsche Geschichte
boardgame.description:
2 Karten:

Sophie Scholl - 3 - Bis zum Ende deines nächsten Zuges darf niemand Karten aus der Hand ausspielen.

Johannes Gutenberg - 1 - Diese Karte hat +5, falls genau 1 Karte in der Auslage liegt.

listing.notes:
New and in shrink (neu und in Folie).
If you have any other questions, please let me know.
I accept PayPal (friends) or sepa bank transfer for payment.

New in shrink. Shipping in Germany would be via DHL. Payment either via Paypal or Bank Transfer.
Local pickup somewhere in Saxony is possible as well. Please message me for that and we can arrange something.

boardgame.name: Coralon
boardgame.description:
Coralon is the base trick-taking game for Crab Fragment Labs' Vines deck. The Vines deck has eleven cards in five suits, including Ace (high) and four face cards: Knight, Bishop, Farmer, and Tar. Below these are the ranks 7 through 2. Games with the Vines deck include several trick-taking games for 3 to 6 players, including cutthroat and team games, based on familiar mechanics from games like Hearts, Pitch, and Euchre, with an abundant assortment of clever innovations.

Players bid on the number of tricks they will win, with the highest bidder leading and choosing trump.

If you make your bid, you score the number of tricks won and your opponents score nothing.

If you make over your bid you and your opponents all score the number of tricks won.

If you make under your bid you score nothing and your opponents score the number of tricks won.

Game ends when one player reaches a winning score (dependent on number of players).

boardgame.name: Five-Star Review Game
boardgame.description:
Everyone on the internet has an opinion. Some more outlandish than others. In this family friendly trivia game there are 5 categories related to reviews left by people on the internet:

One Star Wonders - There are always winners and losers - these are the losers.

Mystery Basket - What's being described here?

Facts & Stats - Sort out the truth from the fake news.

Historical Howlers - Wild reviews from the days before the internet.

Fill in the Blanks - Identify the missing words to complete these reviews.

A sixth category "?" provides a little chaos and randomness with unique challenges provided on each card.

Players move around the board to each of the different category zones trying to collect a star card from each one by correctly answering a question.

First one to collect a star card from each category and make it back to the center of the board wins.

boardgame.name: Kingdoms of Amalur - Fatesworn
boardgame.description: Master the unstable power of Chaos with a unique new non-combat Skill and class of weapons and armor. As the fabled Fatesworn, you will wage a last battle

boardgame.name: DECK 52: Space Wrecked
boardgame.description:
Deck 52: Space Wrecked is a quick solo dungeon crawl card game, where the player fights through randomly generated levels of a derelict spaceship, trying to survive, and reach the escape shuttle.


The game can be played as a single scenario (5-10 min, you win by finding the level exit) or a campaign (a sequence of missions).
Campaign mode (10-20 missions, increasing difficulty, character upgrades).
Each game level is randomly unfolding while you're exploring it.
Combinations of 7 random Objectives (win conditions) and 7 Threats (gameplay modifiers) add more replayability.
Possible to play with standard deck of 52 playing cards.


—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Christmas Remnants
boardgame.description:
"Just a short and fun Christmas themed one shot where you get to kill the corrupted ghost of Santa."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Age of Journey
エイジオブジャーニー
boardgame.description:
Age of Journey is a "slightly" different kind of worker-playing game in which you develop a forgotten village in the mountains. The game is based on the idea that workers (warriors) and resources (livestock) are two sides of the same coin. If you send a large number of people to raid an area, you will earn more money, but you will have fewer actions to perform. In addition, the dominance of the colours over the area makes the management of your warband very difficult. Use the sale market to sell your livestock at a high price and invest in various cards to get rich!

Worker pieces are double sided. On your turn, you choose a number of workers to send to a given space. One worker occupies the space, triggering it's while the remaining workers flip over to become the depicted resources. These resources can then be sold on a variable market, allowing you to buy skills, more workers, and Estates, which are the main source of victory points.

The player with the most victory points after 3 rounds (short & solo games) or 4 rounds (long game) is the winner.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Southern Cross Games (サザンクロスゲームズ)

boardgame.name: Cafe Chaos: Animator Pack
boardgame.description: This pack include 34 cards all based around characters from the YouTube series. It has 9 characters with their own actions, plus 8 foods, 2 toppings, 2 conditions, 2 bonus actions and 2 events.

boardgame.name: The Legend of Zelda Game Comic Part 1
boardgame.description:
A very rare, limited release board game bundled and sold with candy by Bandai.

The players spin the wheel to figure out how much to move (1-3 spaces). Then, they move their token and defeat monsters (also by spinning the wheel) to collect weapon tokens.

Once someone has four weapon tokens, the game turns into the dungeon phase, wherein players race to get to the boss and defeat it, acquiring a triforce fragment. Then the game goes back to the overworld and the process is repeated.

Whoever has the most triforce pieces by the end of the fourth dungeon wins.

boardgame.name: Cafe Chaos: Junk Food Pack
boardgame.description: This pack has 28 new cards focused on expanding your food cards. It includes 2 new character and their actions, 12 foods, 3 toppings, 3 conditions, 3 bonus actions and 3 events.

boardgame.name: Office Survival
boardgame.description:
A card management game with 3-5 players. Players change their positions in each turn so everyone will have a chance to be the boss, or the lowest-level employee. Players have to finish their task with their ability cards and get the merit. According to different position, players can change the situation by using their special ability card. For example, a lower level clerk may shift his job burden to his /her supervisor by using a Sick Leave card.

There are Ability card and Task card. Players pick and collect ability cards first in order to fulfill the condition of getting a task card.

After finishing a task card, player can get coins as reward. Player who first collects 3 black coin wins.

boardgame.name: Mont-à-Mots Mini
boardgame.description:
Help climber Sam reach the yeti at the top of the mountain in this cooperative vocabulary game.

Sam needs your speed and your vocabulary to overcome obstacles and reach the top of the mountain. Roll the dice, find out on a map the challenge you will have to meet and each time you succeed, Sam can move a little further towards his goal.

Players pick a challenge card off the draw stack and roll a die to see how many words they must recite to meet the challenge. If no one can pick a correct word, they must roll the die and move back that many spaces.

Who wins? Whichever team or player first gets Sam to the top of the mountain.


Un jeu de vocabulaire coopératif
Aidez l’alpiniste Sam à rejoindre le yéti au sommet de la montagne!Amateurs de jeu de mots, voilà votre chance de briller aussi en alpinisme avec Sam, qui a besoin de votre rapidité et de votre vocabulaire pour franchir les obstacles et atteindre le sommet de la montagne. Lancez le dé, découvrez sur une carte le défi que vous aurez à relever et chaque fois que vous réussissez, Sam peut avancer un peu plus vers son but.

Qui l’emporte? L’équipe ou le joueur qui, le premier, permettra à Sam d’atteindre le sommet de la montagne.

boardgame.name: Magic: The Gathering – Chronicles
boardgame.description:
An extension of Magic: the Gathering 4th edition. Drawn from the first four Magic: the Gathering expansions. All cards in the set were from the Arabian Nights, Antiquities, Legends, and The Dark expansions (14 from Arabian Nights, 21 from Antiquities, 71 from Legends, and 19 from The Dark). Each card was white-bordered, while the cards in their original sets were black-bordered. Also, each card carried the expansion symbol from the set it was originally printed in.

The set was printed in English and Japanese only. The Japanese version was black-bordered, because as it was the first time those cards were printed in the language. A similar black-bordered set called Renaissance was released into German, French, and Italian markets. These contained a different array of cards.

A famous writer has gone missing, last seen heading into the hills in search of the fabled Hell Mouth rumored to reside in the dark depths of the local mines. Now the Heroes have been hired to find him and bring him back alive. But the dark tidings foretold in his recent stories have begun to bear an eerie resemblance to reality, building toward something sinister.

This limited edition, deluxe resin terrain piece depicts a massive eruption of stone and a swirling portal of darkness – the Hell Mouth, an all-new piece for Shadows of Brimstone, plus a new Mission - Through the Mouth of Madness - themed for the new piece!

The Hellmouth acts as a gate for enemies or the void by doubleing the encounters, attacs or growing dead on the exploration token and adding enemies to fight.

boardgame.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Challenge Pack #2 – Beast Unleashed
boardgame.description:
Legend tells of a sinister beast that stalks the caves and canyons of Black Rock, a thriving mining town north from the ruins of Brimstone. Known as The Devil of Black Rock, they say it towers over normal Slashers and has grown mutated beyond recognition. With four razor-sharp scything arms, it eviscerates its prey, feeding on their souls as it shreds their flesh. Layered in a thick shell of light-refracting Void Chiton, The Devil of Black Rock phases through time and space with shimmering speed, warping in and out of reality as it strikes!

Challenge Pack #2 – Beast Unleashed is themed for facing off against the infamous Devil of Black Rock and his hordes of beastly minions that all use cards from the new Beast Unleashed Enemy Trait cards set. A Legendary foe, hunting the Devil of Black Rock is not for the faint of heart. It shrugs off attacks with its thick shell while phasing through the Void to activate multiple times per turn, shredding the Heroes with each slash!

A Challenge Pack is a new themed set of cards with a terrifying new Enemy and a nightmarish new Mission designed to give the Heroes an extra challenge. These cards are all used together for the included Mission; but can also be added to your card decks to increase the challenge across your normal games of Shadows of Brimstone as well. Many of these new cards are marked with a Challenge Icon, to be easily identified as extra dangerous.

The Expansion contains

The Devil of Black Rock Large Enemy Record Sheet
The Devil of Black Rock Large Resin Figure with 40mm base
Rule Sheet with new Mission – Rampage at Black Rock
30 New Game Cards (4 Darkness cards, 5 Mine Encounters, 5 Beast Unleashed Enemy Traits, and 16 Threat cards)


Challenge Packs reward players for having a robust collection of Enemies and Expansions; and contain several Threat cards that include a mix of various Enemies from across the game. Some of these Threat cards even add new bonus ability to the Enemies on the card for thematic ways that they can work together to crush the Heroes

The following Expansions are highly recommended to get the most out of this Challenge Pack (though these sets are not required to use this Supplement, most of the Threat cards included in this Challenge Pack do use various Enemies from these other Expansions):

Swamps of Death Core Set
City of the Ancients Core Set
Blasted Wastes Deluxe OtherWorld Expansion

Void Swarms and Void Hive Enemy Pack
Dark Stone Scorpions XL Enemy Pack

boardgame.name: The Divisible Man
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Balanced for a party of fourth-level characters, this adventure module for the fifth edition of the world’s most popular roleplaying game is a roleplay-heavy dungeon-crawl through a steampunk funhouse that you’ll never forget.

In the Divisible Man: A clone from a parallel dimension interrupts your heroes’ post-adventure carousing to utter a cryptic warning before dying. The party accepts an invitation from the brain-damaged Mind Mathematical and steps into an extradimensional mansion. They emerge to find a seven-sided civil war with multiversal consequences.

Cockroach Cultists clash against a surrealist Muse and her Avant Guard. Both will happily cut down the heroes the moment they threaten their agendas. Meanwhile, A recently democratized ant colony seeks partisan bipeds for the oncoming civil war. Finally, Representationalist Portraiture desperately defends against absurdist aggression in a weird war for the landscape wing of an increasingly sentient art gallery.

Art or Science? Violence or Inaction? Right or Left? Can you stop worrying and love the bomb? Hard choices are around every corner, and there are no correct answers. Right and wrong have been replaced by Left and Right. Can your heroes navigate the chaos and pick the right direction?

boardgame.name: Tomb of Transformation
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Uncover the secrets of the nearby cemetery and its new denizens: A lycanthropy cult bent on perfect transformation. Dynamic battles with body horror and trickery, this adventure will keep your party guessing just what is going to change next!

“I see you have successfully claimed Karazar’s abandoned lair and the scrying pool is working as well.” The harsh voice emanated from the small bowl of rippling water held in the hands of the brass statue, filling the dark chamber.

“We have been most fortunate that we were able to re-purpose the deterrents left by the builders,” Malain said. “Though I am quite busy with my research, how can I serve you Ther Atul?”

The voice seemed to hiss through the air. “Heir Elmore grows impatient with the pace of your research and demands that you deliver a working potion. Soon. Your concerns for safety and process are slowing down our chance for ascension and we find this delay unacceptable.”

Malain’s hand twitched at the harsh critique of her methods. Best not to mention the runaway cultist, she thought, lest the punishment for it be enhanced by their current displeasure. “I live to serve our great cause Ther Atul. My process is guided by the need to make something that can be replicated and improved upon. I will deliver as promised. Rushing the process runs the risk of further unpleasantness.”

Malain could have sworn she could hear the sound of grinding teeth through the scrying bowl before the rippling stopped and the room was quiet again. She turned to leave and get back to work.

boardgame.name: 4.20 Game
boardgame.description:
In this cannabis-themed party game for adults, each player has to take a card and pass the indicated test. A test is like a challenge, for example, "guess a movie by doing mimic". If you pass the challenge correctly, you earn victory points.

Game ends when there are no more cards. The player with most victory points wins.

Think green and play responsibly. No plants have been harmed during the creation of this game.

ESTE JUEGO DE MESA NO PRETENDE FOMENTAR EL CONSUMO DE SUSTANCIAS NOCIVAS PARA LA SALUD, SIMPLEMENTE OFRECE UNA ALTERNATIVA DE OCIO CREATIVO PARA CONSUMIDORES HABITUALES.

4.20 Game está pensado para amparar la igualdad entre hombres y mujeres, utilizando un lenguaje inclusivo y visibilizando de manera igualitaria la figura del hombre y de la mujer. Para ello las dos mascotas del juego son: “CLARITA LA SEMILLITA Y ANTOÑÍN EL COGOLLÍN”.

Por otra parte en las pruebas que hay que superar se ha considerado la posible diversidad física que pueda presentar cualquier participante. Se trata de un juego inclusivo en el que cualquier persona con movilidad reducida puede participar.

Para finalizar esta presentación es necesario mencionar que durante la creación de este juego no ha sufrido daño alguno ningún vegetal.

boardgame.name: Mini-Eventures II (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Even the smallest town has more locations than all but the most diligent and time-rich GM could ever hope to detail and design. To make matters even worse, when an adventuring party gets to a town or city, the characters often have the irritating habit of going off exploring. What’s a GM to do? Designed specifically for you, the busy GM, the mini-eventures herein help you bring depth and flavour to your characters’ next urban adventure. This compilation is designed for use with City Backdrop: Languard, but can be easily used in virtually any town or city.

This compilation presents 12 mini-eventures.

boardgame.name: Mini-Eventures II (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Even the smallest town has more locations than all but the most diligent and time-rich GM could ever hope to detail and design. To make matters even worse, when an adventuring party gets to a town or city, the characters often have the irritating habit of going off exploring. What’s a GM to do? Designed specifically for you, the busy GM, the mini-eventures herein help you bring depth and flavour to your characters’ next urban adventure. This compilation is designed for use with City Backdrop: Languard, but can be easily used in virtually any town or city.

This compilation presents 12 mini-eventures.

boardgame.name: Dwarven Rage
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A little something extra for your PF2 game!

Pathfinder Second Edition brings a ton of cool classes and options to expand familiar classes like the barbarian in new ways. Dwarves make awesome berserkers and this book creates an entire new Clan's Instinct to tailor your dwarven battlerager to new heights of fury with awesome new class feats like Scattered Traditions, Grudge Ascendant, Invoke the Old Rites, and Swear Clan's Vengeance!

boardgame.name: Tomb of Palu
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An original level 1-2 adventure made for D&D 5e.

The adventurers explore an ancient tomb to break a curse destroying Pine Bend village. Beneath the earth, the party dis- covers the sleeping god Palu, now long forgotten. After braving the god's ritual underworld, the adventurers must make a choice that impacts their world forever.

boardgame.name: Shadowrun: Anarchy 2050
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Play the Hits

Harlequin. Maria Mercurial. Jetblack. Dunkelzahn. The Universal Brotherhood.

These are some of the defining names of Shadowrunlore, the classics that shaped an enduring game universe. Now, for the first time, they’ve been brought to the fast-moving game rules of Shadowrun: Anarchy. With new character archetypes, shadow amps, world information, and a whole bunch of contract briefs, Anarchy 2050gives you what you need to play classic adventures in a new way. Get ready to get caught in the middle of intrigue, deception, gang warfare, political assassinations, and more as your team of runners tries to survive and maybe bring a little light into the shadows.

boardgame.name: Waterloo Solitaire
boardgame.description:
Waterloo Solitaire has 24 games. You take the role of Napoleon commanding the French army for 12 games against an opposing Allied autonomous player side, referred to as the Allied BOT side. And you take the role of Wellington for 12 games, commanding the Allied army against a French BOT side. Each opposing BOT side is rated for its skill; easy for 4 games, medium for 4 games, and hard for 4 games.

One side is played by you (either Allied or French) and uses player actions for the side being playing. The BOT opponent uses the solitaire actions for the other side.

A player can issue one action per game turn from their actions available for the side they are playing. He also has the option of using a Combined Arms Tactics with a supporting action to the one action played. Your choices can cause Die Roll Modifiers (DRM) that affects attacks with results that cause unit eliminations and tactical events to occur.

The object of the game for the French player is to defeat the Allies by the end of the game. This is accomplished by removing all units in 2 of the 3 Allied infantry formations. The object for the Allied player is to avoid defeat by the end of the game. Both sides also have several other ways to win or lose before the game ends.

You will need to provide a pen and one 6-sided die to play the game.

-description from designer
